movie_title: Black Holes Explained – From Birth to Death
introduction:
Black holes. Lets talk about them.


OUR CHANNELS

vocabulary.example: The implosion of the star happened within a fraction of a second.

vocabulary.definition: a subatomic particle with no charge
vocabulary.example: The super nova explosion can produce a neutron star.

vocabulary.definition: a point in space where mass is infinitely dense
vocabulary.example: The singularity at the center of a black hole is still a mystery to scientists.

vocabulary.definition: the point of no return around a black hole
vocabulary.example: Anything that crosses the event horizon of a black hole cannot escape.

vocabulary.definition: to turn from liquid into vapor or gas
vocabulary.example: Black holes will eventually evaporate through Hawking radiation.

vocabulary.definition: a state of matter similar to gas in which a portion of the particles are ionized
vocabulary.example: As you approach the singularity, your body would turn into a hot stream of plasma.
